credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Design for a Serving Spoon
provenance:
Formerly in the collection of Giovanni Piancastelli; From the collection of 
Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash on brown laid paper
description: Large spoon with handle in the shape of herm figure with twisted legs ending in leaves at connection point of handle and bowl. Figure wears a learing expression and carries a quiver on its back.
name: Drawing
